contextId.quote: You must bless the people of Israel
May Yahweh make his face shine on you ... and give you peace

contextId.information: Here the word "you" is plural. Yahweh is speaking to Moses, but he his referring to the priests. The priests will blow the trumpets, Moses will not. AT: "When they blow a loud signal" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: When you blow a loud signal

contextId.information: Here the word "you" is plural. Yahweh is speaking to Moses, but he is referring to the priests. The priests will blow the trumpets, Moses will not. AT: "When they blow a loud signal" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

contextId.information: "be a rule for you." Here  "you" is plural and refers to the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Here "your" is singular and refers to Moses. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"They" refers to members of the tribe of Levi; the word "you" is singular and refers to Aaron. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: They must serve you ... They must join you

contextId.information: Here "you" is singular and refers to Moses, who represents the people of Israel. AT: "Your people may not pass ... to attack them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: You may not pass ... to attack you

contextId.information: Here "your" is plural and refers to the people of Israel. These men will cast lots to divide the land. Then they will distribute it to the tribes. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: divide the land for your inheritance
